message:
Hey, what do you think?
MacBook Air Core i7 VS  Surface Pro-3 Core i7 ?
Considering Apple and MS near future plans

data.message: Add more money and buy macbook pro :D
The size and the battery is big factor for me :)
it depends on your use :)
Business use - a little development and scripting :)
Air is not heavy duty.
Get a cromebook. Or a Samsung compact. Anything. Just stay away from apple and MS
Ahmed Mahmoud reasons ?

Price does not justify value, very bad after-sale and maintenance service in Egypt. For the price of a Mac air you can get TWO very good Samsung compact with better specs and all the freedom to install whatever OS on it.
actually for the price of a mac air, my3rafsh ygeeb 7aga 3dela :D
go for mac air i7. That's if you will not be forced to use windows most of the time :D

Wael Ali Salim
Khaled Sh i tried both Apple TradeLine and BestBuy, best buy is way better than Apple Tradeline in their after sale services

Get Macbook Air. Good thing about it is you can install both Windows and Mac OS (dual boot or virtual machine) which gives you more option rather than just having only Windows/Linux available (although you can still install Mac OS on non-mac devices, it's done through a lot of hooks and the OS won't be stable at all)
I am biased and I will tell you get a surface pro 3.
Mohamed Elsherif was waiting for your response but was looking for a rich justified one with the future plans about Surface pro 4 -  if any
Thanks all
There will be new surfaces that's for sure

Mohamed Elsherif Do you own a Surface Pro tablet? People say you can do all kinds of development work (including WP8 which requires a Hyper-V!) on it without any problems and even some gaming, how much of this is true?
I'm really considering replacing my current 5-year-old HP laptop with a Surface Pro 3 (when I can afford it :D), but I'm still not 100% comfortable about this decision.

I don't own any laptops, I am Desktop guy, for me portability is not important.
All surface line uses Intel (i3, i5, i7) Haswell Processors which are very Strong especially (i5 and i7) and also comes with Intel HD 4400 5000 respectively which are good for gaming (casual gaming and some advanced graphics gaming) but it is not a gaming machine, if you want to game get a gaming console or a Desktop with a dedicated graphic card :)

yeah my plan is to (one day) have Surface Pro 3 and a powerful Desktop at home for gaming (and remote desktop and being a home server keda).
Portability is important for me, I like having a dev and gaming device wherever I am, and I'm getting tired or my bulky laptop woth its huge charger, that's why I'm considering the Surface Pro.

For me I get by with the cheapest possible (almost disposable) tablet I can find for portability - currently I used either my phone or Nexus 7 tablet, and for any serious computing (gaming, working, doing anything that requires bigger screen(s)) I switch to Desktop PC
